abstract: Joanne Bradford, the longtime sales chief at Microsoft, will take that job at Yahoo. The move suggests that display ads are regaining their importance at Yahoo.
snippet: Joanne Bradford, the longtime sales chief at Microsoft, will take that job at Yahoo. The move suggests that display ads are regaining their importance at Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: A year ago, Yahoo pushed aside Wenda Harris Millard as its ad sales chief in favor of David Karnstedt. Ms. Millard was widely admired as the dean of the Internet ad sales world and the person who in many ways led the industry out of the dark days of 2002. Mr. Karnstedt was a veteran of the search advertising business who joined Yahoo when it bought Overture Services, the text ad company.

headline.main: It’s Back to Sales at Yahoo

abstract: Canonical, the corporate sponsor of the Ubuntu operating system, said its newest version, the Jaunty Jackalope, should boot faster and cater to Web-based applications.
snippet: Canonical, the corporate sponsor of the Ubuntu operating system, said its newest version, the Jaunty Jackalope, should boot faster and cater to Web-based applications.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has spent years battling an Apple. Now it must go up against a Jaunty Jackalope as well.

headline.main: The Jaunty Jackalope Hops Aboard Ubuntu’s Ark

abstract: Will Poole, a veteran Microsoft executive, is leaving to focus on non-profit pursuits. His first new project: $70 computers for schoolchildren.
snippet: Will Poole, a veteran Microsoft executive, is leaving to focus on non-profit pursuits. His first new project: $70 computers for schoolchildren.
lead_paragraph: Will Poole, a veteran Microsoft executive, is leaving the company at the end of this month to become a technology evangelist of sorts. Computing, he says, is finally becoming sufficiently powerful and inexpensive enough that it can really help tackle “social and economic problems and has the potential to do it at scale.”

headline.main: Microsoft Refugee Becomes a Social Technologist
